verses.text: Afterward he brought me to the temple , and measured the posts , six cubits broad on the one side , and six cubits broad on the other side , \add which was\add* the breadth of the tabernacle.

And the breadth of the door \add was\add* ten cubits ; and the sides of the door \add were\add* five cubits on the one side, and five cubits on the other side: and he measured the length thereof, forty cubits : and the breadth , twenty cubits.\f + \fr 41.2 \ft door: or, entrance\f*
Then went he inward , and measured the post of the door , two cubits ; and the door , six cubits ; and the breadth of the door , seven cubits.
So he measured the length thereof, twenty cubits ; and the breadth , twenty cubits , before the temple : and he said unto me, This \add is\add* the most holy \add place\add*.
After he measured the wall of the house , six cubits ; and the breadth of \add every\add* side chamber , four cubits , round about the house on every side.

And the side chambers \add were\add* three , one over another , and thirty in order ; and they entered into the wall which \add was\add* of the house for the side chambers round about , that they might have hold , but they had not hold in the wall of the house.\f + \fr 41.6 \ft one…: Heb. side chamber over side chamber\f*\f + \fr 41.6 \ft thirty…: or, three and thirty times, or, foot\f*\f + \fr 41.6 \ft have hold: Heb. be holden\f*

And \add there was\add* an enlarging , and a winding about still upward to the side chambers : for the winding about of the house went still upward round about the house : therefore the breadth of the house \add was still\add* upward , and so increased \add from\add* the lowest \add chamber\add* to the highest by the midst.\f + \fr 41.7 \ft there…: Heb. it was made broader, and went round\f*
I saw also the height of the house round about : the foundations of the side chambers \add were\add* a full reed of six great cubits.

The thickness of the wall , which \add was\add* for the side chamber without , \add was\add* five cubits : and \add that\add* which \add was\add* left \add was\add* the place of the side chambers that \add were\add* within.
And between the chambers \add was\add* the wideness of twenty cubits round about the house on every side.

And the doors of the side chambers \add were\add* toward \add the place that was\add* left , one door toward the north , and another door toward the south : and the breadth of the place that was left \add was\add* five cubits round about. \p

Now the building that \add was\add* before the separate place at the end toward the west \add was\add* seventy cubits broad ; and the wall of the building \add was\add* five cubits thick round about , and the length thereof ninety cubits.
So he measured the house , an hundred cubits long ; and the separate place , and the building , with the walls thereof, an hundred cubits long ;
Also the breadth of the face of the house , and of the separate place toward the east , an hundred cubits.

And he measured the length of the building over against the separate place which \add was\add* behind it, and the galleries thereof on the one side and on the other side, an hundred cubits , with the inner temple , and the porches of the court ;\f + \fr 41.15 \ft galleries: or, several walks, or, walks with pillars\f*

The door posts , and the narrow windows , and the galleries round about on their three stories , over against the door , cieled with wood round about , and from the ground up to the windows , and the windows \add were\add* covered ;\f + \fr 41.16 \ft cieled…: Heb. cieling of wood\f*\f + \fr 41.16 \ft and from…: or, and the ground unto the windows\f*
To that above the door , even unto the inner house , and without , and by all the wall round about within and without , by measure.\f + \fr 41.17 \ft measure: Heb. measures\f*
And \add it was\add* made with cherubims and palm trees , so that a palm tree \add was\add* between a cherub and a cherub ; and \add every\add* cherub had two faces ;

So that the face of a man \add was\add* toward the palm tree on the one side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the other side: \add it was\add* made through all the house round about.
From the ground unto above the door \add were\add* cherubims and palm trees made , and \add on\add* the wall of the temple.

The posts of the temple \add were\add* squared , \add and\add* the face of the sanctuary ; the appearance \add of the one\add* as the appearance \add of the other\add*.\f + \fr 41.21 \ft posts: Heb. post\f*

The altar of wood \add was\add* three cubits high , and the length thereof two cubits ; and the corners thereof, and the length thereof, and the walls thereof, \add were\add* of wood : and he said unto me, This \add is\add* the table that \add is\add* before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And the temple and the sanctuary had two doors.
And the doors had two leaves \add apiece\add*, two turning leaves ; two \add leaves\add* for the one door , and two leaves for the other \add door\add*.

And \add there were\add* made on them, on the doors of the temple , cherubims and palm trees , like as \add were\add* made upon the walls ; and \add there were\add* thick planks upon the face of the porch without.
And \add there were\add* narrow windows and palm trees on the one side and on the other side, on the sides of the porch , and \add upon\add* the side chambers of the house , and thick planks.
